usefulItems: baking tray (20 x 30 cm), baking paper, silicone bread mat, wire rack, sealable storage container, oven, refrigerator
title: Damper with golden syrup butter

ingredients.content: 450 g self-raising flour, plus extra for dusting
80 g unsalted butter, cut into pieces (2 cm)

preparations.content: Preheat oven to 200°C. Line a baking tray with baking paper and set aside.
Place flour, salt, butter and golden syrup into mixing bowl and mix <b>10 sec/speed 6<b>.
Add water and milk and knead <b>20-25 sec/<b>.
Transfer dough onto a lightly floured silicone bread mat or work surface and shape into a round loaf (approx. 18 cm), then place on prepared baking tray.

Dust with a little extra flour, then bake for 25-30 minutes (200°C), or until damper is cooked through and sounds hollow when tapped on the underside. Transfer onto a wire rack to cool. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Place golden syrup into mixing bowl and warm <b>30 sec/37°C/speed 1<b>.
Add butter and mix <b>30 sec/speed 3<b>. Transfer into a sealable container and place into refrigerator until ready to use.
Serve damper warm with golden syrup butter.

hintsAndTricks: Damper is traditionally wrapped in aluminium foil and cooked on the coals of an open fire. An outdoor pizza oven can also be used to bake damper.
To make your own butter to use in this recipe please refer to the recipe in The Basic Cookbook or the Everyday Cookbook.
